trans-unit.source: Code Sample: ASP.NET MVC 3 Custom Login Page
trans-unit.target: Code Sample: ASP.NET MVC 3 Custom Login Page

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Code Sample: ASP.NET MVC 3 Custom Login Page
trans-unit.target: Code Sample: ASP.NET MVC 3 Custom Login Page

trans-unit.source: This sample illustrates how to create a custom login or Home Realm Discovery page in an ASP.NET MVC3 application that uses <token>firstref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This sample illustrates how to create a custom login or Home Realm Discovery page in an ASP.NET MVC3 application that uses <token>firstref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: The code for this sample is located in the <ui>MVC3CustomSignInPage</ui> (C#\Websites\MVC3CustomSignInPage) subdirectory of the <token>ad_acs_code_gallery</token> package.
trans-unit.target: The code for this sample is located in the <ui>MVC3CustomSignInPage</ui> (C#\Websites\MVC3CustomSignInPage) subdirectory of the <token>ad_acs_code_gallery</token> package.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To run this sample, you will need:
trans-unit.target: To run this sample, you will need:

trans-unit.source: An account in the Azure portal and an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: An account in the Azure portal and an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: <token>vs2010</token> (any version)
trans-unit.target: <token>vs2010</token> (any version)

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>ASP .NET MVC3</linkText><linkUri>http://www.asp.net/mvc/mvc3</linkUri></externalLink> (http://www.asp.net/mvc/mvc3)
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>ASP .NET MVC3</linkText><linkUri>http://www.asp.net/mvc/mvc3</linkUri></externalLink> (http://www.asp.net/mvc/mvc3)

trans-unit.source: Windows Identity Foundation SDK
trans-unit.target: Windows Identity Foundation SDK

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <externalLink><linkText>ACS Prerequisites</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065).
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <externalLink><linkText>ACS Prerequisites</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065).

trans-unit.source: Configuring the Sample
trans-unit.target: Configuring the Sample

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration required for this sample can be performed using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration required for this sample can be performed using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes both options.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes both options.

trans-unit.source: Option 1: Configuring the Sample via the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Option 1: Configuring the Sample via the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal

trans-unit.source: To configure the sample in the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: To configure the sample in the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Access Control Service management portal.
trans-unit.target: This action opens the Access Control Service management portal.

trans-unit.source: To establish relationships with the identity providers, click <ui>Identity providers</ui> and then select the identity providers you would like to use, such as, Google, Yahoo!, and Facebook.
trans-unit.target: To establish relationships with the identity providers, click <ui>Identity providers</ui> and then select the identity providers you would like to use, such as, Google, Yahoo!, and Facebook.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to obtain the prerequisite keys for Facebook, see <externalLink><linkText>How To: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221151</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221151).
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to obtain the prerequisite keys for Facebook, see <externalLink><linkText>How To: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221151</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221151).

trans-unit.source: Then click the <ui>Home</ui> link in the left navigation menu of the page to return to the main page.
trans-unit.target: Then click the <ui>Home</ui> link in the left navigation menu of the page to return to the main page.

trans-unit.source: To register your application with <token>secondref_acs</token>, in the Access Control Service management portal, click the <ui>Relying party applications</ui> link located on the main page, select <ui>Add</ui>, and enter the following information in the form:
trans-unit.target: To register your application with <token>secondref_acs</token>, in the Access Control Service management portal, click the <ui>Relying party applications</ui> link located on the main page, select <ui>Add</ui>, and enter the following information in the form:

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter <ui>ASPNET MVC3 Custom</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter <ui>ASPNET MVC3 Custom</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Realm</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:64000/</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Realm</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:64000/</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Return URL</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:64000/Account/SignIn</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Return URL</ui> field, enter <ui>http://localhost:64000/Account/SignIn</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Token format</ui> field, select <ui>SAML 2.0</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Token format</ui> field, select <ui>SAML 2.0</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Identity providers</ui> section, select <ui>Facebook</ui>, <ui>Google</ui>, <ui>Windows Live ID</ui>, and <ui>Yahoo!</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Identity providers</ui> section, select <ui>Facebook</ui>, <ui>Google</ui>, <ui>Windows Live ID</ui>, and <ui>Yahoo!</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Token signing</ui> field, select <ui>Use service namespace certificate (standard)</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Token signing</ui> field, select <ui>Use service namespace certificate (standard)</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui> and then navigate back the main page.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui> and then navigate back the main page.

trans-unit.source: With your relying party application configured, it is now time to create the rules that determine the claims that <token>secondref_acs</token> will issue to your application.
trans-unit.target: With your relying party application configured, it is now time to create the rules that determine the claims that <token>secondref_acs</token> will issue to your application.

trans-unit.source: In this sample, we will pass through all claims issued by the identity providers.
trans-unit.target: In this sample, we will pass through all claims issued by the identity providers.

trans-unit.source: To create this rule, click <ui>Rule Groups</ui>, located on the main page, and click the <ui>Default rule group for ASPNET MVC3 Custom</ui> rule group.
trans-unit.target: To create this rule, click <ui>Rule Groups</ui>, located on the main page, and click the <ui>Default rule group for ASPNET MVC3 Custom</ui> rule group.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click the <ui>Generate</ui> link.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click the <ui>Generate</ui> link.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that <ui>Facebook</ui>, <ui>Yahoo</ui>, and <ui><token>ssWLiveID</token></ui> are selected and click <ui>Generate</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that <ui>Facebook</ui>, <ui>Yahoo</ui>, and <ui><token>ssWLiveID</token></ui> are selected and click <ui>Generate</ui>.

trans-unit.source: With <token>secondref_acs</token> configured, open <token>vs_current_short</token>.
trans-unit.target: With <token>secondref_acs</token> configured, open <token>vs_current_short</token>.

trans-unit.source: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service
trans-unit.target: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service

trans-unit.source: The <token>vs_current_short</token> sample solution has a command line application called <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> which uses the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service and the common helpers defined in the <ui>Common</ui> class library.
trans-unit.target: The <token>vs_current_short</token> sample solution has a command line application called <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> which uses the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service and the common helpers defined in the <ui>Common</ui> class library.

trans-unit.source: This application can be used to configure your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> for use with this sample.
trans-unit.target: This application can be used to configure your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> for use with this sample.

trans-unit.source: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service
trans-unit.target: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service

trans-unit.source: Update the <ui>Common</ui> class library with information about your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: Update the <ui>Common</ui> class library with information about your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: Open <ui>SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui> and enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: Open <ui>SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui> and enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: <ui>ServiceNamespace</ui> - This is the namespace used with <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ServiceNamespace</ui> - This is the namespace used with <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityName</ui> - This is a management service account’s name.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityName</ui> - This is a management service account’s name.

trans-unit.source: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityKey</ui> - This is the password associated with the management service account.
trans-unit.target: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityKey</ui> - This is the password associated with the management service account.

trans-unit.source: <ui>AcsHostUrl</ui> - This is the host name of <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>AcsHostUrl</ui> - This is the host name of <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> project, open <ui>Program.cs</ui> and enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> project, open <ui>Program.cs</ui> and enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: <ui>applicationId</ui> - This is your Facebook application’s Application Id.
trans-unit.target: <ui>applicationId</ui> - This is your Facebook application’s Application Id.

trans-unit.source: <ui>applicationSecret</ui> - This is your Facebook application’s Application Secret.
trans-unit.target: <ui>applicationSecret</ui> - This is your Facebook application’s Application Secret.

trans-unit.source: For details about how to get these keys, refer to <externalLink><linkText>How To: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221151</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221151).
trans-unit.target: For details about how to get these keys, refer to <externalLink><linkText>How To: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221151</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221151).

trans-unit.source: Run the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> application in <token>vs_current_short</token>, which will configure <token>secondref_acs</token> to run this sample.
trans-unit.target: Run the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> application in <token>vs_current_short</token>, which will configure <token>secondref_acs</token> to run this sample.

trans-unit.source: Running the Sample
trans-unit.target: Running the Sample

trans-unit.source: To run the sample
trans-unit.target: To run the sample

trans-unit.source: Open the sample located in <ui>Websites\MVC3CustomSignInPage\MVC3CustomSignInPage.sln</ui> in <token>vs_current_short</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open the sample located in <ui>Websites\MVC3CustomSignInPage\MVC3CustomSignInPage.sln</ui> in <token>vs_current_short</token>.

trans-unit.source: To add <token>secondref_acs</token> as the STS reference, right-click <ui>MVCCustomSignInPage</ui> and select <ui>Add STS Reference</ui> from the context menu.
trans-unit.target: To add <token>secondref_acs</token> as the STS reference, right-click <ui>MVCCustomSignInPage</ui> and select <ui>Add STS Reference</ui> from the context menu.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box, enter the root of the web application into the <ui>Application URI</ui> field and click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box, enter the root of the web application into the <ui>Application URI</ui> field and click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For this sample, this value is <ui>http://localhost:64000/</ui>
trans-unit.target: For this sample, this value is <ui>http://localhost:64000/</ui>

trans-unit.source: The trailing slash is important as it lines up with the values you entered in <token>secondref_acs</token> for your relying party.
trans-unit.target: The trailing slash is important as it lines up with the values you entered in <token>secondref_acs</token> for your relying party.

trans-unit.source: The wizard will issue a warning that your site is not using SSL.
trans-unit.target: The wizard will issue a warning that your site is not using SSL.

trans-unit.source: Accept this warning by clicking the <ui>Yes</ui> button, but remember that a production website should almost always use SSL for these types of scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Accept this warning by clicking the <ui>Yes</ui> button, but remember that a production website should almost always use SSL for these types of scenarios.

trans-unit.source: In the next window, select the <ui>Use Existing STS</ui> radio button and enter the URI of the WS-Federation metadata published by your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: In the next window, select the <ui>Use Existing STS</ui> radio button and enter the URI of the WS-Federation metadata published by your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: That URI can be found on the portal under <ui>Application Integration</ui>.
trans-unit.target: That URI can be found on the portal under <ui>Application Integration</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> is <ui>mvc3samples</ui>, then the URI is <ui>https:// mvc3samples.accesscontrol.windows.net/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> is <ui>mvc3samples</ui>, then the URI is <ui>https:// mvc3samples.accesscontrol.windows.net/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml</ui>.

trans-unit.source: After you enter this value, click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: After you enter this value, click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Since your website does not require encrypted tokens, click <ui>Next</ui> on the remaining dialog boxes, and then click <ui>Finish</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Since your website does not require encrypted tokens, click <ui>Next</ui> on the remaining dialog boxes, and then click <ui>Finish</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Your application is now configured to use <token>secondref_acs</token> with the ASP .NET blanket resource protection.
trans-unit.target: Your application is now configured to use <token>secondref_acs</token> with the ASP .NET blanket resource protection.

trans-unit.source: We need to disable this protection so that we can use our own custom login page with more detailed MVC3 authentication filters.
trans-unit.target: We need to disable this protection so that we can use our own custom login page with more detailed MVC3 authentication filters.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>web.config</ui> file, under <ui>configuration</ui>, delete the following setting:
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>web.config</ui> file, under <ui>configuration</ui>, delete the following setting:

trans-unit.source: Under the <ui>system.web</ui> delete the following setting:
trans-unit.target: Under the <ui>system.web</ui> delete the following setting:

trans-unit.source: With these two settings removed, ASP .NET is not performing any authentication or authorization on our behalf.
trans-unit.target: With these two settings removed, ASP .NET is not performing any authentication or authorization on our behalf.

trans-unit.source: Press <ui>F5</ui> in <token>vs_current_short</token> to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Press <ui>F5</ui> in <token>vs_current_short</token> to run the application.

trans-unit.source: Your browser will take you to the main page of the application.
trans-unit.target: Your browser will take you to the main page of the application.

trans-unit.source: Click the <ui>Sign In</ui> link in the upper-right corner and select an identity provider from the list that appears.
trans-unit.target: Click the <ui>Sign In</ui> link in the upper-right corner and select an identity provider from the list that appears.

trans-unit.source: After authenticating, you will return to the Home page and your user information will be displayed in the upper-right corner (note that <token>ssWLiveID</token> will not provide a user name).
trans-unit.target: After authenticating, you will return to the Home page and your user information will be displayed in the upper-right corner (note that <token>ssWLiveID</token> will not provide a user name).

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Log Off</ui> to log off.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Log Off</ui> to log off.

trans-unit.source: This will clear the session cookies and return you back to main page.
trans-unit.target: This will clear the session cookies and return you back to main page.

trans-unit.source: Click the <ui>Directory</ui> link.
trans-unit.target: Click the <ui>Directory</ui> link.

trans-unit.source: Since you are no longer authenticated, you will be asked to pick an identity provider to access the Directory page.
trans-unit.target: Since you are no longer authenticated, you will be asked to pick an identity provider to access the Directory page.

trans-unit.source: This is because the Directory page (Index in DirectoryController) is protected via the RequireAuthenticationAttribute.
trans-unit.target: This is because the Directory page (Index in DirectoryController) is protected via the RequireAuthenticationAttribute.

trans-unit.source: Once you pick an identity provider and authenticate, you will be directed back to the Directory page.
trans-unit.target: Once you pick an identity provider and authenticate, you will be directed back to the Directory page.
